intro: Dupatya pulla, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb along rocky surfaces. Its flowers are tubular with five lobes and are pollinated primarily by insects. Dupatya pulla is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often found in alpine meadows at elevations above 3,000 meters.
